metadata.title: CVE-2022-43552 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A use after free vulnerability exists in curl <7.87.0. Curl can be asked to*tunnel* virtually all protocols it supports through an HTTP proxy. HTTPproxies can (and often do) deny such tunnel operations. When getting deniedto tunnel the specific protocols SMB or TELNET, curl would use aheap-allocated struct after it had been freed, in its transfer shutdowncode path.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-43552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm14
libcurl3 - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm14
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm14
libcurl3-nss - 7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: curl package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.35.0-1ubuntu2.20+esm14').
